name: CRETINS demo tape
description: Six tracks of pummeling hardcore punk from these Richmond, VA numbskulls. Brash and aggressive stuff in the vein of old classics like NOTA / POISON IDEA or maybe REPOS as a modern point of reference. Ugly, self-loathing vocals and a loud, punchy recording mastered by Will Killingsworth at Dead Air make this thing really kick. In other words, hardcore punk devoid of gimmicks or generic trappings. CRETINS are one to watch out for, that’s for sure. (FEEL IT 03) listen HERE.

name: SLUGZ "Suit and Tie" 7"
description: Raw, trashy garage that eases right up to the border of being hardcore. Richmond, VA mutants smash out three songs on their debut 45. Has the crunch of early rocknroll rooted punk like The Damned mixed with the reckless aggression of Teengenerate or The Retainers. A knockout debut effort! Check out a song HERE. FEEL IT-02

name: LACKEY DIE "s/t" 7"
description: First release on Feel It.  Lackey Die was the first hardcore band from the small city of Charlottesville, Virginia.  Starting out in 1982, they played furious, no-bullshit hardcore.  During this time they recorded two studio sessions, one at Floodzone Studios (White Cross, Unseen Force) and another at the now-famous Inner Ear Studios (Minor Threat, Bad Brains, etc.)  The band broke up in late 1985, leaving behind only some local fans and a couple mentions in MRR scene reports.  25 years later, the master tapes have been re-discovered and remastered for vinyl.  You'll see why Lackey Die would fit in perfectly on an old Southern hardcore mixtape alongside bands like C.O.C., early HONOR ROLE, BEEF PEOPLE, LANDLORDS, NEON CHRIST, etc.  This release is fully authorized and is limited to 500 copies w/ hand-screened sleeves.

name: NUTS! #12
description: Second NYC-centric newsprint blast from the continually excellent NUTS! fanzine.  This new issue features exclusive interviews with PHARMAKON, DAWN OF HUMANS, and NOMAD.  You also get "NY Rippers '79 punk special" with Spoiler/Omegas, reviews, full page spreads from several NYC artists, and quite possibly the best of all, a full-size poster of Emil from DAWN OF HUMANS.  NUTS! #12 might just be the best one yet!

name: NUTS! PACKAGE DEAL (#1-5,7-10)
description:
In celebration of the new issue, Ben (editor of Nuts!) and I thought it would be cool to throw together a kind of "package deal" for those looking to pick up the back issues for a nice price.  So here it is - you get NINE issues of Nuts! zine for $15! (shipping not included)

ISSUE #1: HPP / GUN OUTFIT / Olympia scene report
ISSUE #2:  SEX/VID / BROKEN STRINGS / local writing
ISSUE #3: MILK MUSIC / Judd of SEX/VID reviews local restaurants / wild illustrations & photos
ISSUE #4: WHITE BOSS / NODZZ / HELL WOMAN
ISSUE #5: BRILLIANT COLORS / THE SPITS / ST. DAD / R. Storey comics and illustrations
ISSUE #7: BONE SICKNESS / LIVING EYES
ISSUE #8: MILK MUSIC tour journal / WHITE WARDS
ISSUE #9: CHRISTIAN MISTRESS / Suzie Lucas + Lauren Likely posters
ISSUE #10: GRASS WIDOW / Olympia scene report / Silenzio Statico/LA Raw Ponx scene report

name: ACCEPT THE DARKNESS #9
description: ATD #9 features ace interviews with RANK/XEROX and ILEGAL plus a reprint of a PHILIP K DICK interview with Slash magazine.  Also includes an ATD mixtape (in the style of Distort mixtapes) plus a tastefully expanded range of reviews and editorial content.  A top notch issue of this must-read zine.  Reprinted by Feel It.

name: ANIMAL TEETH demo tape
description: Another regional treat brought to us by Lumpy Records...ANIMAL TEETH say "Up The Chud" and spew forth some disjointed punk dribble.  Loose and cynical, gettin' high on sewer gas.  Similar feel to some of the Rotcore stuff like BAD TASTE or BRAIN CAR mixed with a dose of early BEASTIE BOYS (to my ears at least...in the sense that it's earnest but goofy).  Excellent!

name: AUSMUTEANTS "Amusements" LP
description: FANTASTIC FANTASTIC FANTASTIC LP from AUSMUTEANTS. Having never heard this band before dropping the needle on this long player, I was totally shocked at how well executed and distinctly Australian this record is. Powerful, synth driven, cynical yet not whimsical...something about AUSMUTEANTS screams greatness. I won't even hesitate to say that I'd put "Amusements" in the same league as recent LPs by TOTAL CONTROL, EDDY CURRENT, and ROYAL HEADACHE. AUSMUTEANTS are the real deal, completely capturing all the "lucky country" has to offer. Highest possible recommendation, a contender for best of 2013. Aarght (IMPORT) RESTOCK COMING SOON

name: BAD PEOPLE "Mean Talkin" 7"
description: Second and latest 7" from Buffalo's BAD PEOPLE.  Continues on with the snot-filled, spazzed out sound of their "Pearls Before Swine" EP but I'd say "Mean Talkin" relies more on Biff's heavy, fuzzed bass tone to really nail BAD PEOPLE's mid-paced stomp into your skull.  Calling this band garage punk would be off, yet the clean guitar tone and incredibly snotty vocals don't lend themselves to hardcore.  BAD PEOPLE are truly something original, the genius runt of the litter.  Feral Kid/Feeble Minds/Ut.

name: BAD PEOPLE "The First Seven Inches" tape
description: Collection tape of 13 songs that appear on the "Pearls Before Swine" and "Mean Talkin'" 7"s from Buffalo's BAD PEOPLE.  Nice and loud pro-tape released on the band's own Bad People Records.

name: BAD SIDE "Everybody Wants Something From Me"
description: Who is BAD SIDE? That's the age old question phrased by this Philadelphia five piece.  This two song single answers with speedy blasts of disaffected hardcorepunk intertwined with crushing midpaced grunt.  Sort of reminds me of COLD SWEAT but a touch less straightforward, maybe CONDOMINIUM as a good modern reference point.  I definitely see BAD SIDE appealing to fans of the more offbeat HC being released on Iron Lung and Deranged these days, pretty ace debut! Nervous Habit Records.

name: BAD SKIN "s/t" 7"
description: Sleeper hit from these now-defunct Toronto animals.  Apparently BAD SKIN were the ultimate destructive live hardcore band in Toronto for sometime and were hard to get into the studio.  They finally got these four songs on tape and its pretty darn solid.  Fans of SCHOOL JERKS and HASSLER take note and pick this up.  Includes some great liner notes detailing the live wreckage caused by BAD SKIN.  Canadian import from Bad Vibrations.

name: BASTARD "Wind of Pain" LP
description: A cornerstone of Japanese hardcore.  Hardcorepunkmetal force to forever be reckoned with.  Not much more can be said about BASTARD - just purely punishing and supremely executed HC perfection.  "Wind of Pain" is something you should own, simple as that.  2013 official reissue on Feral Ward.  Trash yer boots.

name: CABIN FEVER #4
description: Latest and best issue yet of this upstart Virginia fanzine.  The thing that shines most here is the ed.'s vastly improved writing, which shines in the new batch of reviews for this issue.  CF #4 is split between hardcore punk and punk art.  In person interviews with France's YOUTH AVOIDERS and Australia's KROMOSOM as well as interviews/art features from NYC's Alex Heir (Death Traitors) and RVA's James Callahan (Barf Comics).  All this rounded out by a few punk fest reviews (NY's Alright review contributed by yours truly) and film reviews plus some ace illustration from the ed.  Worth picking up if you've been on the fence about this zine or have been following it since issue 1.  A stellar new one, for sure.

name: CONCRETE ASYLUM "Social Anxiety" 7"
description: The latest from Toronto's Bad Vibrations label, CONCRETE ASYLUM blast through six tracks of absolute chaos on this 7".  Alternating between fast HC and borderline blast-beat drumming this EP recalls the speed and intensity of UK greats like HERESY and RIPCORD.  Totally noisy and chaotic, I can only imagine how great this band must be to see live!  Canadian import.

name: COUNTERFEIT GARBAGE #7
description: CG #7 gives the majority of coverage to Canuck HC goons VIOLENT FUTURE and WOLFSBLOOD.  Also includes an in-depth review of some classic RZL DZL live shows and a plethora of record/zine reviews courtesy of Tall Rob.

name: DEAD WIFE "Night of the Living Dead Wife" tape
description: Halloween tape from Montreal's DEAD WIFE.  Midtempo punk with a huge low-end and snarled vocals.  Recalls the negative power of the NIHILISTICS mixed with the energy of fellow NYC stalwarts NO THANKS.  Three tracks on the A-side backed with some original Halloween spook sounds.  Recorded by Mr. Node and Vietnam Sam from THEE NODES and essential for fans of that band!  Limited to 100 and self-released.  Canadian import.

name: DEATH CAMP "Teenage Nightmare" 7"
description: Got a few more of these - in case you missed DEATH CAMP they hail from Rochester, NY but are by far the hardest hitting HC band out of the "Rotcore" pack.  Musically, this is slightly metallic power HC with a nice beefy production.  Straight up rough and ignorant stomp underneath gruff and nasty vocals.  Great record and the first release on the upstart Black Rebel label!

name: DEEP WOUND "s/t" 7"
description: A legitimate reissue of this classic USHC release available again on vinyl. Deep Wound were one of a handful of great punk bands from the outer regions of Massachusetts who have been largely overlooked by HC history in favor of the "Boston Crew" bands who put out records on XClaim! or Modern Method. The four-piece recorded their one and only single with Lou Giordano and Frank Michaels (Proletariat) and released it on the Radiobeat label in 1982. The record is snotty teenage punk rock but played at lightning speed with totally manic singing. Armageddon Records.

name: DEGENERATE #11
description:
2013 brings us a new issue of DEGENERATE, this time delving into more depraved tuneage.  Issue #11 features interviews with Mark Cunningham from NY 80s "No Wave" group MARS, the Bay Area's SYNTHETIC ID, Canada's SEX CHURCH, and locals MUSK.  All of this is rounded out by some well-thought reviews and pulled together by a tight layout.  

Note: This issue of Degenerate is supposed to come with a MUSK flexi but I found one zine sans flexi and have adjusted the price accordingly.

name: DIRTY WORK "s/t" 7"
description: Another tasty new platter from Eat The Life, this time courtesy of Kansas City's DIRTY WORK.  Lo-fi no-bullshit hardcore punk that oozes snot and disgust.  I can see fans of the STOIC VIOLENCE demo being into this...also getting some obscure small-town 80s HC vibes from this one ala NAKED HIPPY and NUNFUCKERS.  Scrappy smash that gets the job done.  ETL/Muckracker Recs.

name: DISTORT #42
description: DISTORT #42 - interviews with OMEGAS, new OZ hardcore sensations NS MAYHEM, a great look back at 60s Aussie rockers THE THROB, RED RED KROVVY, BEASTIANITY, and DREW GATES.  Writing/reviews on: E.M. Cioran, Justin Fuller, Oily Boys, Wet Cloth, Soma Coma, Hyperspace Vision, Croation Amor, LR, X-TG / Throbbing Gristle, Lakes, The Clean, Constant Mongrel, U202, Destruction Unit.  You can't go wrong with these new issues.  US edition with red cover printed and distributed by Feel It.

name: DISTORT #41
description: DISTORT #41 - includes a great retrospective interview with THE HUNCHES surrounding the "Exit Dreams" LP, a chat with Canada's NIGHT PROWLER, and AARON ASPINWALL (Repos) about his writing. Also features writing/reviews on: Harry Crews, Repairs, Lost Domain, Waste Management, Factorymen, Jackman, Harald Grosskopf, Whores, Inservibles, Vile Gash, Schizophasia, Bits of Shit, Salvation, No Balls. Plus a great centerfold courtesy of Shiva Addanki. US edition with red cover printed and distributed by Feel It. MORE TO REPRINTED SOON

name: DOWN AND OUT #27
description: Latest in the Nocturnal Emissions Black Metal series (Vol. 5) from Tasmania's DOWN AND OUT.  Issue #27 features interviews with WULKANAZ, CHURCH WHIP, DESGRANGES, BLACK BEASTS, KRUEL KOMMANDO, SLAEGT, NO PLEASURE IN LIFE, NUIT NOIRE, PHANTOM FEEL, and nine pages of reviews.  Clocking in at 50 pages, Down and Out yet again spares no expense at bring you the most in-depth coverage of almost any fanzine out there.  Features a one-color printed cover with artwork from the renowned MEATDOG.  US edition printed by Feel It.

name: DOWN AND OUT #26
description: Comprehensive (46 page) 2013 Hardcore issue of Down and Out.  Features interviews with SALVATION, GOOSEBUMPS, HERPES and some lesser known acts FUMES, NEED, and SCHOOL SHOOTINGS.  Also includes over ten pages of reviews scouring all ugly, noisy, and fucked up HC punk from the past few months.  A serious (aside from the GOOSEBUMPS interview) and almost painfully thorough look at current hardcore punk from Australia's Sam Vince.  US version printed by Feel It.

name: DROPPINGS #1 w/ tape
description: Excellent new Atlanta-based zine from the Scavenger of Death crew.  This first issue of Droppings includes interviews with TOTAL CONTROL, JOINT D, GARY WRONG, and KREMLIN.  Also features an Atlanta scene report which ties right into the accompanying mixtape that showcases Atlanta's regional prowess with tracks from GG KING, PREDATOR, RYAN DINOSAUR, GHB, and DASHER alongside some total obscurities (incl. a wild NEON CHRIST track I'd never heard) plus tracks from all of the bands interviewed in Droppings, save Kremlin.  Great start to a zine which I can only hope keeps churning out new issues.

name: ROKY ERICKSON AND THE ALIENS "The Evil One" 2xLP
description: Talk about an album that defined rocknroll, one that came straight from the shocked mind of ex-13th FLOOR ELEVATORS frontman ROKY ERICKSON almost ten years after psychedelia had faded out, "The Evil One" is a stone classic.  Horror riddled anthems of the highest order, commanded by Roky's trademark scream and put to tape by Stu Cook of CREEDENCE CLEARWATER REVIVAL.  Yes, this is a mandatory listen for anyone who truly appreciates rocknroll music.  It was an awakening, an epiphany, a chilling moment when I first heard this record and I'm still inspired by "The Evil One" every time I spin it.  Light In The Attic has done a masterful job with this reissue, including a huge booklet full of liner notes, photos, and ephemera as well as a boss remastering job and a two headed dog etched on the D-side of this 2xLP.  Essential, highest earthly recommendation.

name: FAMILY OUTING demo tape
description: Outstanding debut from this new UK hardcorepunk group! Seven tracks of snarling, tight-as-nails HC injected with some crushing midtempo moments.  I'd say this fits somewhere along the lines of "Darby Crash" era POISON IDEA mixed with a harder edge ala LIFESBLOOD underneath gruff female vox.  Actually reminds me A LOT of this old Richmond band CROOKED TEETH...that point aside I can see fans of current bands like HYSTERICS, LAST WORDS, STAB, or GOOD THROB (who FAMILY OUTING share members with) really enjoying this demo.  Self released UK import with lyric sheet and unique covers hand-assembled from old postcards sourced from Canterbury, the band's hometown.

name: FLIP SHIT "Outgoing Rockers" 7" - ONE LEFT
description: Got a couple more of these bad boys back in the distro.  Debut 7" from this great  new Rotcore group (that's Rochester, NY for those not in the know).  Has more of a Cali HC vibe in terms of the warm production and killer musicianship, think maybe a bit of CODE OF HONOR spun with the quirkiness of WARKRIME or something.  Great heavy chipboard jackets on this as well, every insert sealed with a kiss, you'll see!  Reel Time.

name: GREEN BERET "The Cult of State" 7"
description: Possibly the best current American band playing in the DISCHARGE via CRUCIFIX tradition, GREEN BERET fucking destroy things on this new EP.  A slightly rawer recording really pushes these songs over the top of the already excellent GB LP.  A total smattering of power and execution.  Top shelf stuff, housed in a tip-on 7" sleeve to boot.  Side Two.

name: HARDCORE ANACHRONISTIC ASSEMBLY #1
description:
INCREDIBLE international fanzine omnibus issue assembled by Tom/General Speech.  HC Anachronistic Assembly #1 features contributions from:  General Speech (US), Concrete Guerilla (US-formerly Accept The Darkness), Radiation Sickness (US), Decaptitated (Japan), Eskupe Al Alkade (Spain), La Ciudad Mas Feo Del Mundo (Spain), Got Myself (US-done by yours truly, first new writing in something like two years!), More Noize (UK), Night Rider More Than Fight (France), and Your War (US).  Content ranges from reviews to interviews to photos to editorials but hell, with this lineup you know you'll be getting quality all the way through.  This has been a long time in the works and I can't say enough about how pleased I am with the result.  Cover art from Teo Hernandez of Eskupe Al Alkade.

*FRENCH CUSTOMERS: Please consider ordering from Remi/Night Rider More Than Fight (hauntinthedark@yahoo.com) as you WILL save on postage and delivery time.*

name: KOWARD "s/t" 7"
description: Second pressing of this essential slab from Boston's KOWARD.  Drawing influence from Scandinavian HC (MOB 47, RIISTETYT) but played with a distinct American feel, these five songs completely destroy.  KOWARD doesn't rely on a wall of noise to get their point across either, making these songs totally memorable.  If you missed out the first time, make sure to snag this EP now! Comes with a sticker too.  Total Fucker.

name: LAKES "Blood of the Grove" LP
description: Description courtesy of No Patience: ‘Blood of the Grove’ – The fifth full length album from Melbourne’s LAKES, and the second to feature the project as a full band featuring members of TAX, ZOND, SPITEHOUSE, TEARGAS, and more. Dark folk meets post punk delivered with military like precision, perhaps best described as ‘medieval chants for the modern age’. 10 track LP for fans of DEATH IN JUNE, ABOVE THE RUINS, JOY DIVISON, and even groups like AMEBIX, mixing bleak pop with an underlying aggression, delivering stark melodies with understated power. Far and away the most realized LAKES offering to date, this beautiful record comes housed in a full colour, matte coated, 20pt jacket with printed inner sleeve on heavy cardstock. No Patience (IMPORT) RESTOCK COMING SOON

name: LAUGHBOY demo tape
description: Two track "cassingle" of oddball psycho hardcore from suburban Illinois.  Guttural vocals and a highly distorted recording really push this in the direction of current stuff like INSERVIBLES or THE FLOOR ABOVE but with a distinctly fucked Midwestern vibe.  Lumpy Recs kills it yet again.

name: LIFE LIKE demo tape
description: Hell...St. Louis is on top of the world right now!  LIFE LIKE are possibly my fave new discovery via Lumpy Records.  This has to be the most straightforward and ripping thing I've heard from Lumpy's camp yet.  Reminds me of BUKKAKE BOYS, SEX/VID, and even fuckin' N.O.T.A. in places.  That being said LIFE LIKE have a nice midpaced snarl that really pushes through the mix and shows their power as a HC band.  Don't snooze on this one!

name: LIFE STINKS I LIKE THE KINKS #1
description:
Newest print piece from DX of DISTORT zine.  First in a series of half-size fanzines dedicated to THE KINKS.  As DX states, "An expression of the sickness of The Kinks and their fanatical audience."  The writing here is a bit of an intro to the KINKS (good for those not familiar past "You Really Got Me", etc.) but also delves into the wild personalities behind the music.  A real cool read featuring cover art from Avi Spivak to boot.  US edition printed by Feel It.

Note: If you have a US subscription to DISTORT, Life Stinks will be included in the upcoming subscriber mailout via Feel It as soon as the new issues of Distort drop.

name: LIMITED CONTRITION #2
description: Brand new issue of this upstart Richmond mag featuring interviews with members of RAT COLUMNS, TOTAL CONTROL, LACE CURTAIN, WHATEVER BRAINS, KITCHEN'S FLOOR, EX-CULT, and IRON LUNG.  Quite a diverse lineup of modern bands represented here and that's all for the best.  Several different minds behind this zine make for a smattering of opinions and interview styles which creates a pretty engaging read.  Also features several pages of reviews and pics.  Even if this isn't the most eye catching fanzine out there, the effort and writing behind Limited Contrition make it worthy of yer time.

name: LIMITED READERSHIP #4
description: Beamed down from Britain...yes, a new issue of Limited Readership.  This thing oozes fandom of sickly punk/hardcore/metal/cinema and all the occult and personality surrounding such movements.  I'll just say the most striking part of LR #4 is the unearthed STICK MEN WITH RAY GUNS interview - just incredible dialogue with original guitarist Clarke Blacker done in 2008 but unpublished until now.  Quintessential anti-social tunes summed up by a man who had to back up BOBBY SOXX!  But moving on, there's a great new interview with Italian legends RAW POWER and quality chats with killer Canuck HC groups SCHOOL JERKS and KREMLIN.  Besides the bands featured, there's coverage of Sabbath album art, New York's Alright fest, cult cinema, and a multitude of contemporary record reviews.  A total package, you freaks.  40 pages with nice glossy cardstock covers.  US edition printed by Feel It.

name: LUMPY AND THE DUMPERS "Sex Pit" 7"
description: Here it is, finally...the vinyl debut for St. Louis' LUMPY & THE DUMPERS.  After a couple excellent tapes, Lumpy recruited some local freaks from bands like SHAVED WOMEN to back him up as THE DUMPERS.  The result has been a string of wild live shows and this here three song 7".  I imagine LUMPY AND THE DUMPERS as an odd growth off some of the freakier first wave US "KBD" punk bands like THE MAD or GIZMOS.  Odd, creeping tempos and pure snot vocals lurch throughout these three songs.  Excellent stuff that really stands out from the pack, and highly recommended.  Full color slimey handscreened sleeve to boot!  Muckracker.

name: MANIPULATION "s/t" LP
description: Complete beast of a hardcore album from Chicago's MANIPULATION.  Simultaneously complex and original, yet outstandingly ripping.  A friend said, "This sounds like Caustic Christ on steroids!".  I laughed but its kinda true, simple but thoughtful and crushing hardcorepunk.  Sorry State.

name: MERCY KILLINGS "s/t" 7"
description: After the fallout of Richmond bands like DIRECT CONTROL, GOVERNMENT WARNING, and WASTED TIME, there really hasn't been much going for hardcore punk in the area.  Finally, some of the heads responsible for those bands have regrouped as MERCY KILLINGS and with this smashing 7" have made it clear that time hasn't changed a thing.  This EP is blazing from start-to-finish, a relentless full-throttle burner.  MERCY KILLINGS rely on the aggression of classic 80's USHC without any young ineptitude, akin to "Kings of Punk" era POISON IDEA or OFFENDERS.  Great looking textured, full-color pocket sleeve with artwork by Guillem (Destino Final) to boot!  Beach Impediment.

name: MESSRS demo tape
description: Another new Midwest HC band to watch out for - MESSRS from Columbus, OH crawl through six tracks of frenzied mess on this demo tape.  Shouted vocals and a crunchy, raw recording really carry the urgency on this thing...sort of recalls early DRY ROT.  In other words, MESSRS play with the urgency of hardcore band but stray from the classic formula in favor of a raw, rumbling psychosis.  Savage Quality.

name: MORE NOIZE #9
description: Newest issue of this UK zine contains short but sweet interviews with FUK, DISORDER and THE WANKYS.  But more importantly there’s a lengthy article about, and interview with, forgotten UK 82 punk heroes STENCH by Rich ‘Militia’ Walker, telling the full uncensored scandalous story of the band along with tons of never-before seen photos. There’s also a story on IT BITES, which was the name of a series of random cassette tape compilations that pre-dates the modern KBD phenomena by compiling the rare, obscure and better-forgotten unsung heroes of shit punk. There is also a passionate love letter to the best GREEK CRUST records of all time, as well as an exclusive interview with Japanese oi/pogo punx THE BOLLOCKS. Finally, as always, expect bad grammer, crap layout, reader’s letters and pages upon pages of reviews of the latest in peripheral punk and hardcore that normal people don’t give a fuck about!  Oh and the cover of the zine is by TEODORO HERNANDEZ (Firmeza-10, OTAN etc).  US version printed by Feel It.

name: NO NEGATIVE "Album Blanc" tape
description: About as bare bones and clandestine as you can opt for, NO NEGATIVE greet the world with this unassuming six song offering.  "Album Blanc" being their second tape after a name change from the over-popularized FUZZ (thanks Ty Segall).  Similar to the approach BRAINBOMBS used to sleaze out STOOGES-styled riffs while beating sensibility into oblivion, NO NEGATIVE do so with a hint of post-punk aftertaste.  I can definitely see fans of PLATES or NEGATIVE PRESS digging on this.  Over 20 minutes of ugliness on this bare bones tape.  Swollen City Records.

name: NUTS! #11
description: HOLY SMOKES, BATMAN! This is truly Nuts!  A brand new issue for 2013 finds the ed. living in New York City and the coverage is rightfully NYC-centric.  Issue #11 includes interviews with LA MISMA, DEFORMITY, and HANK WOOD & THE HAMMERHEADS.  The Hammerheads interview was actually done in part by yours truly and intended for use in a far-oft issue of Got Myself...but all that aside, this issue truly smokes all prior Nuts!  Also included are two posters from Crazy Spirit's Sam Ryser and Heather Benjamin plus show reviews, etc.  This issue also delivers the best print job yet, in my opinion.  A truly stellar effort, get it now!

name: NUTS! #10
description: This zine is just insane.  Issue #10 is consists of another set of HUGE newsprint posters, this time with more writing incorporated.  We get an amazing GRASS WIDOW poster with bio on the backside, show reviews and photography of new Olympia groups like ADJUSTMENT TO SOCIETY, DICK BINGE, GRIMACE, and SPIRITUAL WARRIORS, another review of a classic FARTZ show that ended in a riot, more writing, a second psychotic poster by Danny/Forced Laugh, and the jewel of this issue (I think) - an extremely detailed and visually arresting scene report/poster from the SILENZIO STATICO/LA RAW PONX.  Prepare to have your mind blown and your fingers covered in black ink!

name: NUTS! #9
description: All I can say about this issue is that it is truly NUTS.  Issue #9 includes no less than FOUR full size fold-out posters, two of which include full-color original art by Suzie Lucas, another by Lauren Likely, and finally a giant CHRISTIAN MISTRESS poster.  The cover/credit page can also fold out into an additional poster! Writing in this issue is somewhat limited due to the visual veracity but you get: "A Secret History Of Olympia Girl Punk" by Tobi Vail, live reviews of some Richmond shows from Mike Cool, and a great stream-of-consciousness band feature from editor B.C. Trogdon.  Some bands featured/mentioned include Creamers, Boston Strangler, Brown Sugar, and Arctic Flowers.  Holy shit!!!

name: NUTS! #8
description: Pushing the limits of print media yet again, here's Olympia, WA's newspaper-sized zine, Nuts!  Issue #8 includes a MILK MUSIC summer tour journal, WHITE WARDS interview, show reviews, writing from friends, and even an activities page like you'd see in the back of a real paper, ha!  Also includes a HUGE two-color printed poster.  Full size newsprint, 28 pages.

name: NUTS! #7
description: Nuts! #7 - printed on full size newsprint, reads like a paper! Includes interviews with BONE SICKNESS and LIVING EYES as well as photos, comics, news, reviews, personal ads, a hot & not page, and more.  36 pages, full size newsprint.

name: NUTS! back issues (#1-5)
description:
Back issue selection of Olympia, WA's newspaper size punk zine.  Includes great coverage of mostly local bands and art/photos/writing/opinions from locals.

ISSUE #1: HPP / GUN OUTFIT / Olympia scene report

ISSUE #2:  SEX/VID / BROKEN STRINGS / local writing

ISSUE #3: MILK MUSIC / Judd of SEX/VID reviews local restaurants / wild illustrations & photos

ISSUE #4: WHITE BOSS / NODZZ / HELL WOMAN

ISSUE #5: BRILLIANT COLORS / THE SPITS / ST. DAD / R. Storey comics and illustrations

name: OBLITERATION "War Is Our Destiny" 7"
description: Third and final blast from these Boston blokes.  "Fanks and goodbye - piss off" is the message here with five cuts seething madness and destruction throughout.  Take yer Swedish faves from the 80s, add a touch of Cockney, bit of crossover flavor in the guitar leads, and you might have OBLITERATION.  This easily stands up to and possibly even eclipses their first two EPs so make sure you pick up this fucking thing while it lasts!  Beach Impediment.

name: PARANOIAS demo tape
description: Bare bones demo from this new Philly punk band featuring the infamous Tommy P (Guilty Faces/Mutant Genes) behind the mic again.  Pretty basic, snotty hardcore punk along the lines of some of the earlier SoCal hardcore bands of the 80s, i.e. before hardcore was a popularized style and it was more or less just fast, urgent punk music.  Think stuff like SIMPLETONES and THE LEWD, whose "I'm Not Pretty" is covered to close out this demo!  Pretty cool stuff and definitely a band to watch for if they make it to vinyl.  Self released with lyric sheet.

name: PERSPEX FLESH "Ona" 7"
description: Vinyl debut for the UK's PERSPEX FLESH and a big step up from their demo.  This recording really captures PF's discordant but smashing brand of hardcore punk.  At the same time, this band has an ugly plodding rhythm underneath everything which really builds up the tension in their sound.   Rob from Limited Readership plays guitar in this band and if you've been following his zine you'll have seen NASA SPACE UNIVERSE and RATIONAL ANIMALS coverage.  I definitely feel like PERSPEX FLESH fits into this void of savage music.  Video Disease, gray vinyl.

name: PLATES "Four Horsemen of Beauty" tape
description: Excellent singles collection from the late, great PLATES of Buffalo, NY.  I'd argue that PLATES were extremely underrated, celebrated regionally but never truly embraced outside of Upstate NY.  More than just your average punk band, these guys commanded a rocknroll fueled crunch somewhere along the lines of GUN CLUB but with an MC5 heaviness.  These are only mere reference points though, quite an original band worth your time.  This tape also includes some choice unreleased and live moments.  Feral Kid/Drug Party.

name: THE PROSECUTORS "I've Got A Message" 7"
description: Spot-on reissue of this late 70s punk gem from Milwaukee.  "I've Got A Message" brings to mind a schizoid HEARTBREAKERS with haunting, reverbed-out backing vocals atop some chunky rocknroll riffing.  The B-side kicks up the speed with one more studio cut and one live cut, more along the lines of early 80s Midwest punk like DOW JONES & THE INDUSTRIALS.  Boss stuff and I can't help but wonder why THE PROSECUTORS weren't included on "Bloodstains Across The Midwest"? Scavenger of Death.

name: RAT HEART - "s/t" 7"
description: Debut 45 for these St. Louis rockers.  Feel It was actually supposed to release this record, it's a goddamn rocker either way.  Four songs of Midwest punk with a heavy rocknroll feel.  Serious hot fire guitar playing all over the place.  I honestly think of late 70s American punk like CRIME and THE DOGS mixed with the energy of 90s Crypt bands like NEW BOMB TURKS.  If you enjoyed either of the SLUGZ 7"s then this'll be right up your alley.  Also features Martin of Hey Ronnie zine/Lumpy & The Dumpers on drums! Worth your hard earned pennies, a RAT HEART never dies.  Don't Touch My Records.

name: RED DONS "Notes On The Underground" 7"
description: Latest single from the always-fantastic RED DONS.  This band definitely shines on the 7" format for me.  Both tracks here are around the 5 minute mark and totally make sense taking their own side of the single as opposed to being mashed in on an album.  Anyhow, these new tracks stay true to the classic melodic and forceful punk rock sound patented by THE OBSERVERS and RED DONS.  My copies are on RED wax too! Grave Mistake.

name: ROTTEN UK "Bloody Hell!!" 7"
description: Sort of a curveball for the "Rotcore" scene, but still a very cool record, ROTTEN (UK) grace us with their debut 7".  Very much styled in the No Future / UK 82 sense, ROTTEN UK remind me of some of the grittier, more menacing mid-tempo UK bands like POTENTIAL THREAT or THE INSANE.  In other words, its not as instantly catchy as say, BLITZ, but holds its own in terms of authentic streetwise Punk.  Bloody hell!!  Black Rebel.

name: SALE 7" RECORDS
description: Get these outta here, please! All copies new/unplayed. BAD ADVICE - Do Not Resuscitate 4 songs of snotty SoCal styled punk from Richmond super-group. Tony Bitch. DESPERAT - Demokrati Eller Diktatur Raging Swedish HC from ex-MOB 47 folk. An excellent early release on the Beach Impediment label. FACE THE RAIL - Fractures Cali surf punk with a big "Revolution Summer" era DC feel ala Marginal Man. HERDS - Michigan dark, noisy Midwest hardcore punk. follow up to their LP on Fashionable Idiots. LUCHA ETERNA - Mijo Cipitio fast Clevo HC with Spanish vox. Features a member of Bad Noids. Handscreened sleeve! MAD WORLD - s/t hateful Boston/NY style HC from VA, Euro import. MAMMOTH TORTA - s/t excellent instro surf punk from Cali. Terrible looking sleeve but a total sleeper hit. POOR CHOICE - Teenage Love Is Beautiful fast and energetic youthful HC from Chicago giving love the 625 Records style. various sleeve colors. REDFLESH - Raw War Debut 7" from these Copenhagen monsters and it is a ripper! Imagine Von covering GISM and recording a demo in a cardboard box. SOUTHSIDE STRANGLERS - Strangle You Second/final single from SSS. Little more rocked out on this one, maybe a hint at the LP we never released. Again, old band copies just found, light sleeve creasing. TRENCH ROT - s/t surprisingly good Discharge style mixed with American hardcore. Reminds me of early Knife Fight. WHITE WASH - s/t Ripping Canadian HC, people from Born Bad and Self Interest. Limited to 300 copies on Kill Someone You Hate Recs.

name: SALE ZINES
description: DISTORTION FAITH #5Half size Swedish zine featuring CITIZENS ARREST, DISCHANGE, MASSACRE DIVINE, SPHC RECORDS, and more. STITCHES IN MY HEAD #3 CUNTZ, CHURCH OF HYSTERIA, LOW LIFE, F, all-Australian scene report. STITCHES IN MY HEAD #4 ROYAL HEADACHE, BITS OF SHIT, HAVITTAJAT, w/ 11x17" poster. SUBJECT #2 GG KING, B-LINES, FOREIGN OBJECTS, and MALLWALKERS. Half size w/ two-color screenprinted cover.

name: THE SECRET PROSTITUTES "Welcome To Punk..." LP
description: 2nd LP from Houston's SECRET PROSTITUTES.  "Welcome To Punk, Viva La Evolución, We Can Do Whatever We Want" delivers 25 tracks of jittery schizoid punk rock.  The original catch with SP was Adit's vocals in Indonesian, however they've almost totally thrown that out the window with songs in 7 different languages on this LP.  SECRET PROSTITUTES remind of late 70s Euro punk bands like IVY GREEN and PANIC in the sense that they're well-cultured punk freaks rocking with reckless abandon.  Ace LP.  Torture Garden Picture Co.

name: SEVEN INCHES TO FREEDOM #12
description: This excellent, long-running Florida zine returns to half size with a brand new issue.  Starts out with a pretty eye-opening column from Bob Suren and then dives into a PANZRAM tour journal written by Joe.  Not your typical tour journal either - as this one is told through reviews of demo tapes and live sets by bands that PANZRAM gigged with on each night of the tour.  Bands featured include: LONGINGS, PUBERTY WOUNDS, STRANGERS, PERFECT PUSSY, HEATS OF FORMATION, BROKEN PRAYER, SPACE WOLVES, JAPANESE WOMEN & more.  All this is rounded out by some record reviews and pulled together by the tight layout you've come to expect from SITF.

name: SEVEN INCHES TO FREEDOM #11
description: SITF finally makes the jump to full size for issue #11! Features interviews with NYC's SHOXX, Florida's EX-BREATHERS, former MRR columnist MYKEL BOARD (done days after he was let go by MRR), plus "east coast pogo attack pt. II", "my first record story" by Matt Average, columns, reviews, and more! Recommended reading.

name: SEX BEFORE SUICIDE #2
description: Back in print!  Second issue of this excellent French fanzine detailing all things full of fucked-up spirit from cinema to punk to oddball subculture.  SBS #2 includes interviews with UV RACE and FNU RONNIES as well as features on POISON IDEA, LIGHTNING HOPKINS, and GG ALLIN.  The rest of this issue is packed out with sleaze, reviews, ramblings, just overall journalistic excellence.  US version printed by Feel It.

name: SICKOIDS "No Home" 12" EP
description: Goddamn, talk about a strong follow up to last year's LP on Residue...SICKOIDS waste no time on this new 12" EP.  Ramping up the speed on this one for sure, six tracks at 45rpm fly by in no time.  Total rippers, all of em get me thinking ARTICLES OF FAITH, UPRIGHT CITIZENS, REBEL TRUTH, etc.  Ace record for the ages.  Grave Mistake/Sorry State

name: SLUGZ "Empty Space" 7"
description: New SLUGZ record (actually from the same recording session as the Suit and Tie 7" that I released) finally out now! This record has its roots in rocknroll but is too fast to be passed off as just a rocknroll punk record. Definitely has a bit of an HC feel at times, wild agitated vocals and fuzzed guitars. Not the typical hardcore single you'd associate with past Richmond bands either. Maybe take bits of early west coast punk/HC, a bit of 90s Crypt style bands without the cheeseball attitude or artwork, and a bit of more rocked out riffs at times. Might sound weird on paper, but give it a listen HERE. On Cowabunga Records, might even have some slime green color vinyl for the first few orders.

name: SLUGZ "Psychedelic Slugz" shirt
description: "PSYCHEDELIC SLUGZ" design - black tees with white/slime green print. Design courtesy of Australia's Meatdog. Professionally screen printed on Gildan Ultra Cotton tees.  NEW round of shirts with stronger print.

name: SLUGZ "Empty Space" shirt
description: "EMPTY SPACE" design - artwork from the new Slugz 7" printed in white/red on a black tee.  Newest design, brand new shirts pro screenprinted on Gildan Ultra Cotton tees.

name: SLUGZ "Leather Slug" shirt
description: "LEATHER SLUG" design - white tees with black print. Design courtesy of Australia's Meatdog. Professionally screen printed on Gildan Ultra Cotton tees.

name: SPERM demo tape
description: New hard-charged rustbelt hardcore punk from Buffalo's SPERM.  Operating with an array of influences and bounding between straightforward HC and off-kilter drudgery, SPERM are damn hard to classify.  Maybe take parts of AmRep label bands, NOMEANSNO, and upstate NY oddity and you'd be somewhere close?  Definitely a band you have to hear for yourself to judge, and that's not a bad thing either.  Self released.

name: STATE POISON "Fack Oof" 7" FLEXI - ONE LEFT
description: Two crushing new tracks from these Frenchies on a one-sided clear flexi disc released for their recent US tour.  Definitely in line with previous material riding the noisy-but-incredibly tight HC sound this band has become known for.  Kick Rock.

name: SUCKED DRY "Dog Children" LP
description: Stellar LP from Kansas City's SUCKED DRY.  Wow, this thing totally knocked me back at first listen - the sound here being much more focused and powerful than all their previous output combined.  SUCKED DRY have really honed in their sound with "Dog Children", ditching pure speedy HC to create a crushing, atmospheric mindfuck.  At times I hear a bit of RORSCHACH due to how dissonant and ugly this sounds but SUCKED DRY alternate to SIEGE-esque speeds in the blink of an eye.  Overall this LP is just so damn original sounding that it defies comparison.  A true standout for 2013 and man, what a pleasant surprise! Not Normal/Muckracker.

name: TWERPS "Blood Spit Boys" 7"
description: Second EP from these W. Mass sensations, this time on Eat The Life Recs.  "Blood Spit Boys" picks up pretty much right where the first TWERPS record left off, hard hitting, catchy mongoloid punk.  Right up the same alley as WICCANS or early FUCKED UP, three tracks that really stick.  Black vinyl ltd. to 300.

name: THE UKIAH DRAG "Jazz Mama Is Crying" LP
description:
Finally, copies of the incredible UKIAH DRAG demo pressed to 12" wax at 45 rpm.  Loud, desert fried, loosely psychedelic dribble from these young madmen.  Simultaneously channels early GUN CLUB and a distinct downer vibe that's quite hard to draw comparisons to.  Brooding, albeit engaging stuff that really plants a foot into whatever you might be doing whilst listening to this record.  Highly recommended and self released/already sold out at the source.  

Scrounged up a few more copies, these are the last ones I'll have!

name: VAASKA/IMPALERS split 7"
description: A perfect pairing of two of the best HC bands from TEJAS ! I'm usually not one for split 7"s but when this record was announced I knew it would be gold.  VAASKA and IMPALERS operate in the realm of " d-beat" HC but really cut through the standard fare thanks to the brilliant guitar playing of shared member Vamps and some goddamn stellar songwriting.  Crushing!  Beach Impediment.

name: WILD HEX demo tape
description: Yet another great new demo from the unlikely current hotspot of St. Louis!  WILD HEX give us a lo-fi dose of rocked out punk spit out in fine fashion.  Kind of reminds me of mid-80s Cali punk like FANG or LOS OLVIDADOS in the sense that these guys play dirty, rhythmic punk but add to the mix with some tasty leads and snarling vocals.  Another great snapshot of the current Midwestern state of mind.  Don't Touch My Records.

name: THE ZINGERS "s/t" LP
description: Here's the Quaalude, the downer of the bunch, the real elephant in the room, the fucking ZINGERS.  A band that has been unabashedly chasing away fans in Melbourne, Australia with their unique blend of anti-punk and backwards fashion for years.  The ZINGERS are full color behemoths, talented fuck-ups smashing riffs into oblivion, sadists who decided to end it all short of releasing this LP.  For the past couple years I've been receiving great hand-cut promo posters and tales of live excess from singer Randy Richard and now that I've got the ZINGERS on wax...now I know.  Strumbling guitar wash, primal snot snarl, and great rhythmic grunt emanate from this record in the cracked mold of cult greats like GEZA X and THE CRUCIFUCKS while serving a notion completely unique to the ZINGERS own philosophy.  Rest in piece, you billion dollar babies.  Million Dollar Records.

name: V/A "Welcome To 2013" LP
description: 40 minutes of Hardcore Punk madness featuring new/exclusive tracks by Adjustment To Society, Aspirina Infantil, Big Crux, Bored Straight, Broken Prayer, Brown Sugar, Culo, Good Throb, Haute Couture, Hondartzako Hondakinak, Inservibles, NASA Space Universe, Negative Degree, Ooze, Porkeria, Tenement, and Thee Nodes and art by Amos Pitsch (Tenement), Ben Trogdon, Drugface, and Josh Davis. Comes in two-color screen printed jackets with a twenty page booklet.  Not Normal.
